Reference

Cohort definitions

Cohorts are time series-orientated sets of patient records: selected for their shared characteristics (eg. all strokes admitted within a given time period). Cohort definitions are objects in R to describe the rules to form a cohort of patient in R, and provide metadata about the cohort (such as the cohort name, a description of how that cohort was selected, etc).

cohort_definition()

Creates a new cohort_definition object

is_cohort_definition()

Test if the object is an cohort_definition

cohort_slice_first_team() cohort_slice_last_team()

Return first or latest team in a SSNAP patient episode

aggregate_cohort_on_period_type()

Group a cohort by a date period range

source_data_columns()

Find source data columns from a set of expressions

Audit measures

Audit measures are measures of quality that will be performed upon each record within the cohort. They can either be discrete (ie. the record met or did not meet criteria), or continuous (ie. a measure of time or some other continuous variable). These are represented as individual audit_measure objects, which define the measure and provide metadata about it (such as a name, and descriptor of what is being measured and why).

audit_measure() audit_measure_continuous() audit_measure_discrete()

Creates a new audit_measure object

is_audit_measure()

Test if the object is an audit_measure

create_output()

Create outputs from an audit_measure object

create_descriptors()

Create descriptions of an output from an audit_measure

create_categories()

Create categories of an output from an audit_measure

create_data_type_label()

Create data type label for an output from an audit_measure

Audit output specifications

A series of audit measures must be applied to a cohort to produce aggregated and anonymised results for analysis. We define a table of audit measures together as a group called an audit output specification. The way to do this is to create a tibble with pre-defined columns describing which measures should be applied together: the primary column of which contains each individual audit measure. as_audit_output_spec describes the other columns needed in this tibble.

as_audit_output_spec()

Coerces a tibble to become an audit output spec.

is_audit_output_spec()

Test if the object is an audit_output_spec

Cohort Data Definitions

Once a cohort has been defined, and an audit output specification describing the summary values of audit measures has been defined, these need to be put together to make a cohort_data_definition object. This is what will be passed to create_cohort to then produce a cohort of data with the summary statistics requested.

cohort_data_definition()

Creates a new cohort_data_definition object

is_cohort_data_definition()

Test if the object is a cohort_data_definition

Creating a cohort

There are two useful outputs that can be created from the data. Record-level output can be created using create_filtered_cohort, which takes a cohort data definition and applies additional filtering to it. This is primarily for us in realtime dashboards or internal team reporting where knowing patient detail is required. create_aggregated_cohort returns summarised aggregated and anonymised data about each patient and is used for external-facing reports.

create_aggregated_cohort() create_filtered_cohort()

Create a cohort from a cohort definition and audit output spec

SSNAP measure, audit output and cohort definitions

SSNAPStats works by building a library of calculations to apply to cohorts of stroke patient data - both at record (individual patients) level and for aggregation (summary statistics of patients grouped by time period or treating team). These are mainly applied by the cohorts function to make our cohorts, but they are exposed for use by other packages if required. Fields are created at record level; measures are aggregations of sets of records. For information governance purposes we want data to be handled in aggregated form only wherever possible unless it’s essential to expose individual patient detail.

ssnap_cohorts()

Create a cohort of SSNAP data

ssnap_scores()

Create the SSNAP Scores summary from multiple cohorts

ssnap_cohort_names

Pre-built SSNAP cohorts

ssnap_cohort_definitions

Define available cohort definitions

ssnap_cohort_filters

Filters used in the creation of cohorts for SSNAP

ssnap_field

Record-level data fields built from other data fields

ssnap_measures

Define available auditing measures

aggregated_output_kis_72hrs

Team and Patient 72hr Cohort Key Indicators

aggregated_output_ac_72hrs

72hr Audit Compliance Measures

aggregated_output_casemix_72hrs

Casemix 72hr Cohort Aggregation of Measures

aggregated_output_portfolio_72hrs

Portfolio 72hr Cohort Aggregation of Measures

aggregated_output_kis_discharge

Portfolio Discharge Cohort Key Indicators

aggregated_output_kis_team_post72hrs

Team post-72hr (all teams) Cohort Key Indicators

aggregated_output_portfolio_post72hrs_7day

Portfolio post-72hr Cohort 7Day Aggregation of Measures

aggregated_output_portfolio_post72hrs_discharge

Portfolio post-72hr Cohort Discharge Aggregation of Measures

SSNAP summary statistics definitions

Summary statistics definitions are sets of calculations applied alongside the audit output specification to perform calculations upon the aggregated data. Summary statistics have to refer to the names of the generated rows (eg. a median as ColumnNameQ2.) Common applications are for creating therapy compliance calculations from other domain results for the therapy domains; or calculating the SSNAP scores for each domain or key indicator.

summary_values_therapy_compliance

Summary Values For Therapy Compliance

summary_values_ssnap_scores()

Summary Values For SSNAP Scores

SSNAP report periods

SSNAP reporting periods were initially quarterly, following the financial year. For the 2016 and 2017 financial years, reports have been trimesterly (4-monthly). From April 2018, three-monthly has returned. This makes working out the report period from the date and vice versa complicated. These functions assist with that, and are used by SSNAPStats, SSNAPReports and SSNAPDashboard.

report_period_start_date_in_period()

report_period_start_date_in_period

report_period_end_date_in_period()

report_period_end_date_in_period

ssnap_report_period()

Convert a date to the report number active at that time.

ssnap_report_period_series

Tibble Time time series for SSNAP report periods

ssnap_report_year_series

Tibble Time time series for SSNAP report years

Bank holidays

Vectors of bank holidays for England, Wales and Northern Ireland for looking at working patterns outside of normal working hours.

bank_holidays_engwales

A vector of the bank holidays in England and Wales

bank_holidays_ni

A vector of the bank holidays in Northern Ireland

The Fake Hospital sample dataset

Fake data for testing and developing code without using real patients.

ssnap_fake_data

SSNAP fake data (for testing / development)

Internal functions

These are used within the code but are not exported; you only need to know how they work if you are modifying SSNAPInterface.

internal_time_difference()

Calculate difference between two date or times inline

Deprecated functions

These are functions at the end of their lifecycle, and are in the process of being removed or replaced. This may be because a better method has been found; or it might be because it is no longer needed or is better located elsewhere within our package suite; but work is ongoing to remove all dependency on the code. The documentation should be clear what the intended development direction with the function is. Once we are happy all dependency on the code is removed it and its documentation are removed.

deprecated_na_percentage()

deprecated_na_percentage

deprecated_time_difference()

internal_calculated_field_functions_discharge
